notes: An alleged drug pusher and his accomplice were killed during an anti-drug raid by the police on 1 Feb 2016 at San Jose del Monte City, Bulacan.

A car bomb exploded on 2 Feb 2016 at Jose Abad Santos Street, Tacurong City, Sultan Kudarat, injuring three people. Leni Robredo, who is running for Vice President under the Liberal Party, was present in the area for campaigning and narrowly escaped the bombing, although it is unknown whether she was the target of the bombing. No-one claimed the attack although the Moro Islamic Freedom Fighters (MILF) are suspected to have been the perpetrators.
Two suspected New People's Army (NPA) members were killed in a clash with the Army on 3 Feb 2016 in San Isidro, Bato, Camarines Sur.
A soldier of the 46th Infantry Battalion was killed during a clash with the New People's Army (NPA) on 3 Feb 2016 at Sitio Biasong in Barangay Napnapan area, Pantukan, Davao de Oro.

Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) burned two houses as they were withdrawing from a clash with the Army. The event occurred at Purok 7, Sitio Biasong in Barangay Napnapan, Pantukan, Davao de Oro on 3 Feb 2016.

Two soldiers of the 46th Infantry Battalion were killed and two more soldiers were wounded during a clash with the New People's Army (NPA) (Pulang Bagani Command 3), who set off explosive devices in Sitio Sapang Tin-aw in Barangay Tibagon area in Pantukan, Davao de Oro on 3 Feb 2016.

Seven members of the Marine Battalion Landing Team-10 were injured in a road bombing on 4 Feb 2016 in Barangay Lagtoh in Talipao, Sulu. The improvised explosive device is suspected to have been planted by Abu Sayyaf.

Progressive groups led by the Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) staged a protest on 4 Feb 2016 at the US embassy in Manila, Metro Manila demonstrating against the atrocities committed during the Philippine-American War and subsequent colonial dominance. [size=no report]
The Abu Sayyaf detonated a roadside bomb on 4 Feb 2016 in Patikul area, Sulu when a military convoy of the Marine Battalion Landing Team 10 was passing, injuring seven soldiers.

A clash occurred between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army's Second Mechanized Battalion at Sitio Dagading, Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo on 5 Feb 2016, wounding one Army commander.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed assailants in Delos Santos Street in Tonsuya, Malabon, Metro Manila on 5 Feb 2016. A paper note alleging the victim's involvement as a drug pusher was recovered from the crime scene. The police assumes that the crime could be attributed to an armed group targeting drug pushers in Malabon.

An Army captain and another soldier were wounded as the Army's 1st Mechanized Brigade clashed with the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) on 5 Feb 2016 in Barangay Butalo (Butilen), Datu Salibo, Maguindanao.

Two civilians were injured during sporadic fights that occurred between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army during the night of 5 Feb 2016 and morning of 6 Feb 2016 near Datu Salibo town area, Maguindanao .
Defusal: the military defused an improvised explosive device (IED) on 5 Feb 2016 in Sitio Bulabog, Barangay Bonbon, Patikul, Sulu. The IED had been planted by Abu Sayyaf.

Defusal: The Army's 1st Mechanized Brigade defused an improvised explosive divide (IED) planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) under a bridge in construction in Barangay Butalo (also referred to as Butilen as per The Philippine Star), Datu Salibo, Maguindanao. The BIFF had allegedly planted the bomb as they are opposed to the bridge construction project.

Agreement: Moro natives (led by Satar Manalondong) and an Ilonggo group (led by Dodong Lunsagay) settled their land conflict that had previously claimed dozens of lives in a peace agreement in Kidapawan City, Cotabato on 5 Feb 2016.
Three Bangsamoro Islamic Fighters (BIFF) members were killed and at least seven BIFF members were injured during fights with the Military that occurred on 6 Feb 2016 in Datu Salib town area.

Over 200 people, including members of the group Concerned Citizens of SantaCruz (CCOS), blocked the highway in Santa Cruz, Zambales on 6 Feb 2016 in protest against the mining company Zambales Diversified Metals Co. Inc. (ZDMC) that is transporting nickel ore to port. One protester was arrested, another protester was allegedly hurt by the police.

Local residents staged a barricade in Barangay Bayto, Santa Cruz, Zambales on 6 Feb 2016 in order to block trucks hauling nickel ore. Over a dozen of rioters were hurt as the police violently dispersed the barricade. [size=over a dozen]

Property destruction: The BIFF torched two heavy equipment of a company dredging the Butilen river near Datu Salibo area around the 6 Feb 2016. The reason for the torching was the BIFF's opposition to the infrastructure project.
A barangay leader was shot dead by unidentified attackers on 6 Feb 2016 in Cabiao, Nueva Ecija.

Local residents staged a barricade in Barangay Bayto, Santa Cruz, Zambales on 7 Feb 2016 in order to block trucks hauling nickel ore. Over a dozen of rioters were hurt as the police violently dispersed the rioters. [size=over a dozen]
The mayor of Bongao, Tawi-Tawi was wounded as he was shot by two unidentified motorcycle-riding men in Baliwasan, Zamboanga, Zamboanga del Sur on 7 Feb 2016.

Skirmishes between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army's 22nd Mechanized Company detachment occurred on 7 Feb 2016 in Barangay Butalo, Datu Salibo. The reason for clashes were government-led works on a dredging project in the area, to which the BIFF is opposed.

A chief of the Civil Security Unit (CSU) of North Cotabato's provincial government and his companion were shot dead by the New People's Army (NPA) in Arakan, Cotabato on 7 Feb 2016. The NPA indicated that the reason for the shooting was the chief's past criminal involvement.

An activist and member of Kahugpongan sa Mag-uuma sa Magcagong (Kamama) was shot dead on 7 Feb 2016 by suspected members of the 25th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Poblacion, Maragusan, Davao de Oro. Kamama opposes the presence of soldiers and human rights violations in Maragusan villages.

Over 200 people, including members of the group Concerned Citizens of SantaCruz (CCOS), blocked the highway in Santa Cruz, Zambales on 7 Feb 2016 in protest against the mining company Zambales Diversified Metals Co. Inc. (ZDMC) that is transporting nickel ore to port. Two protesters were arrested.

An Abu Sayyaf member was killed in a clash with the Army's Joint Task Group Sulu in Sitio Annur, Barangay Buanza, Indanan, Sulu on 7 Feb 2016. The ASG member was wanted for his involvement in the Sipadan kidnapping and the pearl farm kidnapping in Samal, Davao del Norte in 2001.

A grenade explosion hit the house of an Isabela City councilor in Isabela City on 7 Feb 2016. The Councilor is also running for mayor of Jones town under the Liberal Party. No-one was hurt during the explosion.

A high-ranking member of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) was arrested and his escort killed during a military operation in Kalanganan, Cotabato City on 9 Feb 2016. The victim was killed as he resisted the arrest and fired at the military, who retaliated with fire.

Soldiers of the 46th and 71st Infantry Battalions fired cannons at local residents in Mascareg, Barangay Anitapan, Mabini on 9 Feb 2016 as an attack against activists protesting against large-scale mining operations.

Defusal: On or around 9 Feb 2016, the Joint Task Group Sulu (JTGS) involving the military and the police intercepted a plot of the Abu Sayyaf (led by Majan Sahidjuan) to conduct a bombing in the town of Jolo, Sulu. The JTGS followed by increasing security in the area.

source: Manila Times; Bulatlat; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 9 Feb 2016, in Compostela, Davao de Oro, suspected military members shot dead a female market vendor in the Compostela town center. The victim was allegedly mistaken for her sister who was a member of the CFA. CFA is opposed to the Agusan Petroleum Mining Company (AgPet) and had reported harassment by the military in the past.

The Army's 46th and 71st Infantry Battalions fired rifles at and bombed mining and civilian communities in Pantukan area (as well as Mabini, see next event) on 9 Feb 2016, as reported by rights group Karapatan. One miner was killed and several civilians injured.

Defusal: The Army cleared roads of landmines planted by suspected Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) near the Butalo bridge in Datu Salibo area, Maguindanao on 9 Feb 2016. The BIFF is demanding a road-right-of-way payment from the government as they are opposed to infrastructure projects in the area.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Thai News Service
notes: A clash between the New People's Army (NPA) and the Army's 46th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Tagdangua, Pantukan area, Davao de Oro on 9 Feb 2016 resulted in the death of an NPA member and the wounding of several others. A soldier was also wounded during a clash at Barangay Tagdangua, Pantukan.

On 9 Feb 2016, in Pantukan, Davao de Oro, the Army's 46th and 71st Infantry Battalions fired rifles and bombed mining and civilian communities in Barangay Napnapan. A farmer was killed and several others wounded. The victim opposed the entry of the Agusan Petroleum Mining Company (AgPet) in the province.

Firefights between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army's mechanized units occurred on 9 Feb 2016 at the boundary of Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Datu Salibo area and Datu Piang towns, as the BIFF is opposed to ongoing infrastructure projects in the area. Four BIFF members were killed, including the BIFF leader while seven others were injured. The event triggered evacuations of civilian residents of the three towns. In another encounter between BIFF the Army' 1st Mechanized Brigade in Datu Salibo on 9 Feb, another BIFF sub-leader, was killed.

A sister of an activist-farmer, was killed in Barangay Poblacion, Compostela, Davao de Oro on 9 Feb 2016. As per the Kilusang Mayo Uno group, the victim was killed by the Army due to her anti-mining activist connections. The activist was member of the militant Compostela Farmers' Association (CFA).
The chairman of Barangay Rumang-ay was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Echague town, Isabela on 10 Feb 2016.

The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) clashed with the Reconnaissance Company of the Army's 6th Infantry Division (ID) at the border of Datu Salibo area and Datu Piang towns, Maguindanao, leaving one soldier and four BIFF members dead.

Defusal: The military and police defused an improvised explosive device (IED) planted at Don Roman Vilo Street, Cotabato City. There are some indications that the bomb could have been planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) although they were not confirmed.

The women's group Lila Pilipina (uniting former 'comfort women' abused during World War II) staged a protest on 10 Feb 2016 at the Japanese Embassy in Pasay City, Metro Manila demonstrating against the Japanese government's attempt to revise history in United Nation relating to 'comfort women'. [size=no report]
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Kabacan town, North Cotabato on 10 Feb 2016.

The Moro Islamic Liberation Front (MILF) and the Army clashed in Barangay Dawang area, Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 10 Feb 2016. One MILF member was killed, while one civilian, one MILF member and one soldier were wounded.

An Army sergeant of Army's 22nd Infantry Battalion (IB) was killed and his companion wounded during an ambush by suspected New People's Army (NPA) in Barangay San Isidro, Libmanan town in Camarines Sur on 10 Feb 2016.
An exchange of fire occurred between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army near Rajah Buayan town area, Maguindanao on 10 Feb 2016.

A candidate for councillor in Batangas was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding men in Barangay San Pablo, Santo Tomas, Batangas on 11 Feb 2016. The police suspect that the reason for killing could have involved land dispute.
Two army troopers of the Army's 50th Infantry Battalion's were killed during a clash with the New People's Army (NPA) at Sitio Bacras, Barangay Apatan in Pinukpok, Kalinga on 11 Feb 2016.
A clash occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) and the 46th Infantry Battalion at Sitio Post, Barangay Napnapan, Pantukan, Davao de Oro on 11 Feb 2016.

A clash occurred between the New People's Army's (NPA) and soldiers of the 73rd Infantry Battalion in Sitio Binaloy, Barangay Marabatuan, Jose Abad Santos, Davao Occidental on 11 Feb 2016. A soldier was wounded, several casualties were suspected on the NPA's side.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Clashes occurred between New People's Army (NPA) rebels and the Detachment of 5th CAFGU Active Auxiliary (CAA) Company, 72nd Infantry Battalion at Sitio Riverside, Barangay Napnapan, Pantukan, Davao de Oro on 11 Feb 2016.
An exchange of fire occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) and soldiers of the Alpha Company, 67th Infantry Battalion at Barangay Panansalan in Compostela on 12 Feb 2016.

Defusal: On 12 Feb 2016, the military and police defused an improvised explosive device placed near the highway at Buluan town area, Maguindanao. The bomb, suspected to have been placed by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF), was likely planted in order to sabotage Maguindanao's Sagayan Festival held in the locality.
Three drug suspects were killed during a police anti-drug raid in Barangay Upper Sepaka, Surallah, South Cotabato on 12 Feb 2016.

A suspected New People's Army (NPA) member and a trooper of the Army's 75th Infantry Battalion were killed in a clash in Barangay Santa Fe, Tagbina, Surigao del Sur on 12 Feb 2016. Another soldier was wounded.
A firefight occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) and the military at Sitio Iraya, Barangay Sangat area, Gubat, Sorsogon on 12 Feb 2016.
An Abu Sayyaf member was shot dead after attacking a soldier of the 10th Infantry Battalion in Barangay Buhanginan, Patikul, Sulu on 12 Feb 2016.
Weapons seizure: The Army confiscated four improvised explosive devices (IEDs), ammunition and other war material from the New People's Army (NPA) in Gubat, Sorsogon on 12 Feb 2016.

Poor patients held a protest on 12 Feb 2016 at the National Kidney Transplant Institute (NKTI) in Diliman, Quezon City, Metro Manila, demonstrating against the NKTI's removal of 80-percent discount for poor patients. [size=no report]
A barangay chairman of Barangay Mabuhay, San Jorge, Samar was shot dead by unknown motorcycle-riding assailants at Barangay Rosalim, San Jorge on 13 Feb 2016.
A candidate for councillor in San Francisco, Surigao del Norte was gunned down on 14 Feb 2016 in San Francisco. Retorta was running for councillor under the Liberal Party (LP).

An unidentified group (suspected to have been Abu Sayyaf) abducted three fishermen and demanded ransom. The boat was hijacked between Basilan and Zamboanga City on 15 Feb 2016. By 20 Feb 2016, two fishermen had been released, but ransom was still being demanded.

A clash occurred between the Army's 5th Infantry Division and the New People's Army (NPA) at Sitio Mally in Barangay Cawayan area, Asipulo, Ifugao on 15 Feb 2016. An army officer was wounded in the clash and later died.
Public health workers and other government employees marched to Chino Roces bridge in San Miguel, Manila, Metro Manila on 16 Feb 2016 in protest against the proposed Salary Standardization Law 4.

Six police members were killed and eight were injured in an ambush staged by the New People's Army (NPA), who detonated a bomb and initiated fire at the Regional Public Safety Battalion near Barangay Santa Margarita area, Baggao, Cagayan on 16 Feb 2016. The NPA stated that the attack had been carried out in order punish gold mining in the area.

assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Philippines); Former NPA: New People's Army
source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Front Line Defenders; ProtectDefenders.eu
notes: A radio broadcaster was shot dead by an unidentified gunman in Purok Bagong Silang, Barangay Poblacion, Pitogo, Zamboanga del Sur on 16 Feb 2016. The victim had been reporting on illegal drugs and illegal gambling in the area. The victim was also a former NPA member.
Six Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) were killed while two soldiers were injured during a clash west of Datu Salibo area, Maguindanao on 16 Feb 2016.
The New People's Army clashed with the military's 8th Infantry Battalion in Barangay Can-ayan, Malaybalay City, Bukidnon on 16 Feb 2016.

Four people were killed while three others were wounded after an improvised explosive device (IED) detonated under their car along the road in Barangay Lower Salbu in Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 16 Feb 2016. The bomb is thought to have been planted by Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF). The fatalities included a treasurer of Datu Salibo town as well as his companions.

Unidentified motorcycle-riding men hurled a grenade at the office of Mindanao Tulong Bakwet, a non-government organization helping families displaced by conflict in Maguindanao. The event occurred in Cotabato City on 16 Feb 2016.
Arrests: The police and military arrested a ranking New People's Army (NPA) leader and his companion in Madaum, Tagum City, Davao del Norte on 16 Feb 2016.
Property destruction: The New People's Army (NPA) torched property of Bruscan, a construction company carrying out irrigation projects. The incident took place in Baggao area, Cagayan on 16 Feb 2016.
Defusal: The military defused a bomb planted at the roadside in Gindulungan, Maguindanao on 17 Feb 2016.

Student groups staged a protest against the candidates of Liberal Party who attended an event of the government agency National Anti-Poverty Commission (NAPC) held at the University of the Philippines (UP) in Diliman, Quezon City on 17 Feb 2016.
The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) detonated a roadside bomb and clashed with an Army's detachment during several instances in Aleosan area, North Cotabato on 18 Feb 2016.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: An exchange of fire occurred between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and a detachment of the Citizens Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) in Barangay Pagangan, Aleosan on 19 Feb 2016.

A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police at Barangay Bliss, Tuguegarao City on 18 Feb 2016. An Ilagan City Mayor and a police officer were wounded as the drug suspect hurled a grenade.
A drug suspect was killed during an anti-drug raid by the police at Barangay Santo Cristo (assumed Bulakan city) Bulacan on 18 Feb 2016. Four more drug suspects were arrested.

An independent mayoral candidate running for mayor of Banisilan town, North Cotabato was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Wao, Lanao del Sur on 18 Feb 2016. The victim was running as an independent candidate. (The political affiliations of the involved actors are unclear.)
Two transmission towers were destroyed by explosives set off in Tadao, Pasuquin, Ilocos Norte on 18 Feb 2016.
Four soldiers were wounded in a clash between the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) and the Army in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 18 Feb 2016.

Two police officers were killed when suspected New People's Army members opened fire in Barangay Caningay, Candoni, Negros Occidental on 18 Feb 2016. Two other officers and three civilians were wounded.
An Army officer was killed and seven other soldiers were wounded during fights with Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Barangay Tee, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 19 Feb 2016.

A police officer was shot dead and his companion seriously wounded by unidentified assailants while the policemen were on duty in Barangay Real, Calamba, Laguna on 19 Feb 2016. A possible motive of the shooting could have been drug-related.
Youth groups staged a protest on 19 Feb 2016 at the Chinese Consulate in Makati City, Metro Manila demonstrating against China's missile deployment in Paracel Islands, South China Sea.

Environmental activists and Tondo residents staged a protest on 19 Feb 2016 at the Department of Environment and Natural Resources (DENR) in Diliman, Quezon City, demanding the closure of Rock Energy coal stockpiling operation in Port Area, Tondo, Manila, Metro Manila.

The New People's Army (NPA) and the military's 8th Infantry Battalion clashed in Barangay Iba, Cabanglasan, Bukidnon on 19 Feb 2016. The NPA was allegedly planning to bomb a government project in the area, which was prevented by the Army.

A former combatant of Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF), two current MNLF members and a son of an Abu Sayyaf leader were killed and another one was wounded in a clash in Sitio Santos, Barangay Buanza, Indanan, Sulu on 19 Feb. The shootout was reportedly motivated by rido (feud) between the MNLF and Abu Sayyaf.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) attacked an army detachment of the 51st IB in Barangay Bayabao, Butig area, Lanao del Sur on 20 Feb 2016. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)
A policeman was killed while another one was wounded upon being shot by unidentified assailants while off-duty in Barangay Kalawisan, Lapu-Lapu City on 20 Feb 2016.
A civilian was injured in a grenade attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Batulawan, Pikit, North Cotabato on 20 Feb 2016. The reason for the attack is suspected to have been a rido (feud).
An improvised explosive device planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) killed a soldier and wounded five others in Datu Salibo area, Maguindanao on 20 Feb 2016.

assoc_actor_2: Government of the Philippines (2010-2016); Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: Unidentified armed assailants attacked the house of a councillor in Barangay Aurora, Alicia town, Isabela on 21 Feb 2016. Two village watchmen were wounded.
A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Lapu-Lapu City on 21 Feb 2016. One policeman was injured.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Clashes between the Army's 51st Infantry Battalion and the alleged Omar Maute Group (other sources mentioned an 'affiliate of Jemaah Islamiah' as well as the Khilafah Islamiyah Movement (KIM)) continued in Barangay Bayabao (Poblacion) in Butig, Lanao del Sur on 21 Feb 2016. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)

Weapons Seizure: The Army's 10th Infantry Division captured a New People's Army (NPA) improvised explosive device (IED), several weapons and war items during a raid in Sitio Muling, Barangay Gupitan, Kapalong, Davao del Norte on 21 Feb 2016.

A boy died and 41 persons were wounded after three unidentified assailants threw grenades at a village carnival in Barangay Poblacion in Esperanza town, Sultan Kudarat on 21 Feb 2016. The Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) are being blamed for the attack, although allegations were not confirmed.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Scout Ranger
source: Philippine Star; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Business Mirror (Philippines)
notes: 22 February. Three civilians were killed and at least three others were wounded when the Army's 3rd Scout Ranger battalion clashed with the Abu Sayyaf group in Sitio Tamara, Barangay Bohe-Ibu in Lamitan City, Basilan on 22 Feb 2016. Other reports mentioned two civilian fatalities only.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Military forces continued its offensive against foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) in Butig town area, Lanao del Sur on Feb 22. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)

A social welfare officer of Tungawan town was shot dead by armed assailant in Sitio Beverly, Barangay Timbabawan, Tungawan, Zamboanga Sibugay on 22 Feb 2016. The victim was a supporter of a late Tungawan mayor, who had been assassinated earlier.
Students, professors and parents staged a protest on 22 Feb 2016 at the Supreme Court in Manila, Metro Manila calling on the Court to act on their petitions against the K to 12 education program.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Barangay Bantilan, Infanta, Quezon on 22 Feb 2016. Further 21 people were arrested during the raid.

The military captured a camp of the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) in Barangay Tee area, Datu Salibo, Maguindanao on 22 Feb 2016 after 24 days of heavy clashes. (No fighting mentioned for Feb 22.)

Farmers, scientists and environmental activists staged a protest on 23 Feb 2016 in front of government agencies in Quezon City (Department of Agriculture, Department of Environment and Natural Resources, Department of Science and Technology, Department of Health, Department of Trade and Industry and Department of Interior and Local Government) condemning the new policy on genetically modified organisms.
Five persons were injured when unidentified assailants set fire to a dormitory, which also served as an evacuation camp of Lumad refugees at Haran Center in Davao City on 23 Feb 2016.
A New People's Army (NPA) leader was killed during a clash with the 68th Infantry Battalion in Barangay Kalangangan area, San Fernando, Bukidnon on 23 Feb 2016.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Military forces continued its offensive against foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) in Butig town area, Lanao del Sur on Feb 23. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)
An unidentified armed group clashed with the Army's 2nd Mechanized Battalion in Barangay Cadapaan area, Balindong, Lanao del Sur on 23 Feb 2016, leaving one soldier wounded.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: A soldier of the 51st Infantry Battalion was killed in an ambush staged by the suspected Khilafah Islamiyah Movement (KIM) in Barangay Bubong Cadapaan area, Balindong, Lanao del Sur on 23 Feb 2016. (Maute coded as main actor, as the group is believed to lead the ongoing attacks in Butig town area.)
A soldier was wounded in an ambush staged by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pantara-Bato, Tugaya area, Lanao Del Sur on 23 Feb 2016.
Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at the University of the Philippines (UP) in Los Banos, Laguna.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Military forces continued its offensive against foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) in Butig town area, Lanao del Sur on Feb 24. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)
Various progressive groups staged a protest on 24 Feb 2016 in Manila, Metro Manila condemning the torching of the Lumad evacuation center in Davao.
Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at the Commission on Higher Education Regional Office in Davao City.
Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at the University of the Philippines (UP) in Cebu City.
Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at the University of the Philippines (UP) in Baguio City, Laguna.
Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at the University of the Philippines (UP) Diliman, Quezon City, Metro Manila.

Students and youth groups protesting against tuition and other school fees increases staged a walkout on 24 Feb 2016 at universities in Manila, Metro Manila, including at the University of the Philippines (UP) Manila, University of Santo Tomas (UST) and Polytechnic University of the Philippines.
A soldier of the Army's 31st Infantry Brigade was killed in a clash with New People's Army (NPA) in Barangay Bentuco, Gubat, Sorsogon on 24 Feb 2016.
Three soldiers were killed and 11 other soldiers were wounded as the military clashed with the Omar Maute Group in Butig area, Lanao del Sur on 25 Feb 2016.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: Military forces continued its offensive against foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) and seized a militant stronghold in Butig town area, Lanao del Sur on Feb 25. Over the course of the fighting (20-25 Feb), three soldiers were killed and 11 wounded, while 42 fatalities were reported on the Maute side (45 fatalities divided across 6 events.)
Defusal: On 25 Feb 2016, the authorities defused an improvised explosive device planted by unidentified perpetrators in Midsayap area, North Cotabato.
A police agent (asset) was shot dead and his wife wounded by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Pahina Central, Cebu City on 25 Feb 2016.
A bomb planted by unknown assailants exploded in Barangay Narra, Sultan Kudarat, in Maguindanao on 25 Feb 2016.
25 February. One Abu Sayyaf member was killed and two members were captured during a shootout with the police and military in Jolo, Sulu on 25 Feb 2016.

The police narrowly escaped a landmine explosion carried out by the New People's Army (NPA) in Barangay Kibia area, Matalam, North Cotabato on 26 Feb 2016. A shoot out between the two groups followed.
A village leader of Barangay Ubay was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion South, Pian town, Zamboanga del Norte on 26 Feb 2016.

assoc_actor_1: JI: Jemaah Islamiyah; KIM: Khilafah Islamiyah Movement
notes: 26 February. Military forces continued its offensive against foreign and local armed men led by the Maute brothers (some sources mention Khilafah Islamiyah Movement and the Jemaah Islamiah as involved groups) in Butig town area, Lanao del Sur on Feb 26.
The New People's Army (NPA) clashed with the 2nd Infantry Battalion in Daraga area, Albay on 26 Feb 2016. One soldier was wounded.
A soldier was wounded in a clash between the Army's 23rd Infantry Battalion and the New People's Army (NPA) in Sitio Kitondaw, Barangay Sangay area, Buenavista, Agusan del Norte on 26 Feb 2016.
Around 200 environmental activists staged a protest in Santa Cruz town proper, Zambales on 27 Feb 2016, denouncing the destruction of the environment by extractive companies operating in the region.
Around 200 rioters staged a barricade in Barangay Uacon, Candelaria, Zambales on 28 Feb 2016 in order to block trucks hauling nickel ore to port.

Two civilian adults and two children were killed in an ambush staged by unidentified assailants near Cotabato City Jail on 28 Feb 2016. The police is determining whether the event could have been motivated by a rido (feud).

A group of armed assailants, including both policemen and other armed men, attacked a police station in Barangay Bubong, Bacolod Kalawi, Lanao del Sur on 29 Feb 2016. At least six civilians, including a teenage boy, were wounded. The motive for the attack is suspected to be linked to a local political campaign.

Over 400 protesters blocked the highway in Barangay Uacon, Candelaria and Santa Cruz towns in Zambales on 29 Feb 2016 in order to prevent the mining company Benguet Nickel Mines, Inc. (BNMI) from transporting nickel ore. The police dispersed the crowd.

Local residents staged a barricade in Barangay Uacon, Candelaria, Zambales on 29 Feb 2016 in order to block trucks hauling nickel ore to port. Several people were injured as the police used batons and shields to disperse the demonstration.
